title: Reliquia
description: Soft, climactic track with delicate yet powerful vocals and a floating, classical feel. Takes you around the world.

title: Ice In My OJ
description: Constant rock beats with sprinkled explosive roughness, real talk from a powerful artist.

title: Letting Go
description: Bright synths and driving beat that feel expansive, nostalgic, and full of momentum.

title: Big Brown Eyes
description: Fast-paced, rage diffusing tune that talks about a shitty ex.

title: fanatsmas
description: Mariachi-inspired instruments and vulnerable Mexican Spanish male voice make you feel like you're flying through clouds while remembering loved ones.

title: REM
description: Song in Spanish has melismatic vocals that take you from soft places to soaring hights, while beat follows perfectly.

title: How Easy
description: Modern country inspired sad song that ponders leaving a loved one that might be making you lose a part of yourself.

title: La Perla
description: Genre-bending, satisfying and elegant ex-partner rant in Spanish. Two artists' voices blend perfectly, making you waltz in your mind.

title: Sugar Talking
description: Sassy and sincere delivery of someone who knows what they want. Guitar strings in the right place make you feel a slow yet strong groove.

title: All I Wanted
description: Slow-burn that explodes into cathartic emotion, with vulnerable vocals and massive release. Feels like holding something in for too long and finally letting it go.

title: Soy Easy (To Fall In Love)
description: Smooth, reassuring vocals that are delivered with a warm sweetness. Makes vulnerability feel safe and sincere.

title: Touch & Go
description: Floaty production and soft delivery that feels like a soundtrack to a 90s movie. Kind of like reviving a memory you never understood.

title: Sugar
description: Playful, punchy, and a little unhinged in a good way. Almost like seeing colors bouncing.

title: Letting Go
description: Bright synths and a leading beat that feel full of momentum. Introspective by moving forward while still looking back.

title: 3 AM
description: Late-night restlessness with a beat and sultry vocals that makes you feel cheeky. Deals with unresolved feelings that are still buzzing.

title: Think Too Much
description: Soft chants that convey the quiet spiral of overthinking. Gentle ear-candy that soothes, but kinda stings you.

title: One Of The Greats
description: Big and unfiltered emotions delivered by Florence's classic hard-hitting dramatics. Makes you twirl endlessly while banging your head like her.

title: Ego Death At A Bachelorette Party
description: Uncomfortable for some, brutally honest, and confrontational towards how the singer sees the world currently. Makes you face your insecurities as they are.

title: Augustine
description: Poem-like feel with melodic spoken words. Distant vocals create a surreal, floating atmosphere - signature Dev Hynes. Subtly incorporates Krio (language from Sierra Leone). Kinda makes you feel like you're in a small budget, indie movie.

title: Half Mast
description: Contrasting vocals - from almost nasally spoken to bright head voice create a mist of nostalgia. Feels like artist is trying to plea for someone to come back to their life.

title: My Love
description: Classic ballad feel with a heartfelt delivery that makes it feel timeless yet leaning into 'old-love-song' vibe. If you listen closely you can almost find a new instrument every time you hear this song again.

title: In Your Feelings
description: Classic Mariah, but now with a mature tone. Tempo change is very pleasing and the instruments highlight every word's meaning. Highlights awareness of a relationship's decline but not necessarily knowing how they got there. Makes you want to move on, while being just a bit reluctant.

title: Catching Bodies
description: Sekou knows what he wants and is aware of temptation. Has sort of a retro energy and sharp delivery that hits hard and consistently with each beat. Made to move through anger, not around it.

title: Caesar in a TV Screen - Ides of March Version
description: Theatrical energy, artists seems comment on a specific male performer persona and how public perceives it. Song deal with insecurities and hypothetics. Sound builds as tempo picks up and the artist's voice fills the room.

title: Throw Down
description: Tension builds as soon as you hear Stevie. As Lindsey joins, you feel the resentment as if it was yours. Like a confrontation you’ve been rehearsing in your head.

title: Calling After Me
description: Longing weirdly well matched with uptempo beat - jangly guitars and synth sound makes it fresh. Expresses the excitement of the initial 'chase' between two people.

title: Fire & Lightning
description: Stripped-back production that feels emotional and powerful. Their voices is like liquid fire, hitting ear-candy high notes and sparking some static as some rasp appears to shock you.

title: No One's Watching Me
description: Loose, cheeky collaboration that feels unguarded and connected with someone. Sax and Olivia's voice make you feel the comfort of being yourself when no one’s looking.

title: Let Me Love You
description: Velvety vocals that have an earthy edge by Amber. Great for strutting when having somewhere to go. Calm convitcion of connection with someone.

title: The Scythe
description: Heavy and dramatic storytelling that feels mythical and personal. Anger and vulnerability clash while almost time-travelling to your last days and talking with loved ones for the last time.

title: Glum
description: High-pitched Hayley, amlost child-like, acts as your intrusive thoughts while normal Hayley gives you hard truths. Makes you sit with feelings you usually avoid.

title: Parachute
description: Crystal clear vocals that keep you company while free falling and feel all the feels, even before her voice intentionally goes more grungey. Head banging and mouthing 'I thought you were gonna catch me.'

title: who's your boyfriend
description: Bouncy tension with a jealous sub-layer. Sounds playful, but feelings related to something unresolved are brewing.

title: Vampire Bat
description: Sticky hooks and whimsical production - classic yet 100% satisfying Glass Animals. Like being orbiting around someone else’s strange world.

title: say something
description: Muted insecurity and overthinking that becomes in pleading out loud (or is it just in your head?). Like practicing a script to confront someone.

title: undressed
description: Bare and vulnerable delivery by an almost echo of a voice - yet it feels exposed. Kinda feels like bad communication led to distance between people in a relationship coming to an end.

title: Nothing Matters
description: Firm confidence paired with reckless release - the artist's voice feels famliar even to the unfamiliar ear. Feels like doing what it takes, without caring for the consequences, just to feel free and the guitar, keys, trumpet, and drums fuel this feeling.

title: Midnight Sun
description: Sparkly pop production that feels hopeful and endless. Like chasing light when it’s about to fade, and doing it all over in a loop.

title: Color Esperanza
description: Consistent percussion drives an optimistic feeling. If you know Spanish, the lyrics bring the sun on a cloudy day. Makes you motivated.

title: Fame is a Gun
description: Addison takes this 'cool girl' persona and delivers high tempo pitched vocals. Talks about dangers of the spotlight but makes you indulge.

title: When I Feel It
description: Bond movie feeling by sampling The Dyamic Suepriors. Conveys powerful but controlled emotions, that you feel directed to you. Makes you wanna bop.

title: don't wanna break up again
description: Soft, direct honesty that feels pretty while it hurts. Like you already know something's gonna end, but you’re trying to slow it down.

title: Angel of Mine
description: Pure, classic R&B tune that covers strong feelings for someone who has had great impact in your life. Monica's sweet voice hits like a love letter.

title: Che strano amore questo amore
description: Playful, strut-inducing groove with an old-school Italian swag. Feels like dancing through a messy crush with a cheeky smirk.

title: Corazón Partío
description: Heartbreak that cuts clean, carried by a Spanish guitar and a husky voice that really means it. Feels dramatic in a good way, making you want sing at the top of your lungs.

title: Little Things
description: Gentle, introspective, and bouncy, like noticing small details with big meanings. Soft enough to focus, but emotional enough to linger.

title: Garota de Ipanema
description: Easy, timeless sway sound that makes the room melt. Portuguese sounds especially endearing here - makes you want to live in slo-mo while enjoying your day.

title: Where Have You Been
description: Out of this world voice conveys big feelings, zero holding back. Feels like turning confusion into strength and letting it echo in the stratospheric climax.

title: Headphones On
description: Escapist pop that makes you enter your own little movie. Light and shiny but deep if you listen closer. Made for moving through the city and observing.

title: Something Heavy
description: Sincere rock that feels like carrying an unknown weight and ponder about the world. Builds until you want to scream-sing in the car.

title: People Watching
description: Deep and emotional song that talks about missing your past self while looking outward. And yet makes you fully cognizant that evryone lives in their own little world. Sam's voice and deliverable makes it highly relatable.

title: Blade Of Grass
description: Quiet devotion that feels grounded and real, like love without performance. Simple and tender in a way that sneaks up on you.

title: Vanish Into You
description: Raw pop that makes you feel raw emotions as Gaga's piercing honest rapsy tone goes sits on the mid-high belts. Big hooks and a floaty rush that makes you forget your own thoughts and want the kind of love she sings about.

title: Lost on You
description: Rasp and heartbreak that feel yours. Like admitting you miss someone while pretending you don’t.

title: Photograph
description: Textbook great rock song that talks about longing that feels like going through memories you need to relive. Big chorus, very car-ride worthy.

title: Tu Carcel
description: Old-school heartbreak in Spanish that deals with being left but highlights how the other person might be somewhat misserable. Feels like singing pain out loud makes it a little lighter.

title: Black Hole
description: Elbowing obstacles to move forward while the lyrics spiral a bit. Feels like getting pulled in, but choosing to escape.

title: last night's mascara
description: Soft sadness with a glossy finish, makes you want to feel acknowledged and valued by someone who hasn't in the past. Feels like replaying a night you wish you could re-do.

title: Labios Compartidos
description: Latin rock talking exploring heartbreak and jealousy in a poetic way. Like you’re arguing with your own memories as you relive them.

title: The Crying Room
description: Heavy mood that draws you slowly, self-reflective in the sense that surfaces feelings you’ve been avoiding. The tension stays in your chest and then cracks open with Vera's ghostly wails.

title: Akira
description: Bouncy, colorful cheeky chaos that also feels clean and intentional. Makes you visualize a fast montage of a future decision chain.

title: ROCKMAN
description: Hazy guitar strings with vocals that feel like they’re coming from another room. Comforting, like sinking into a thought you don’t want to leave.

title: Spotlight
description: Big voice and feelings from Jennifer, zero apologies. Empowering and helps you with confidence, let it blast through the speakers.

title: Fantasy
description: Glimmering pop rush that encourages self-acceptance in a cheeky way. Fun and light but you can for sure bop to it.

title: Happy Mistake
description: Takes you on a journey. Gaga starts tender and honest and then goes into room-filling rawness. Like admitting you miss something that hurt you.

title: Don't Let Me Get Me
description: Straight up self-sabotage with a punchy kick. Feels like laughing at your own mess while still kinda spiraling.

title: Ojos Noche
description: Soft Spanish pop that feels like whispering a secret you’ve been holding onto to someone you trust. Warm but a little haunted in a pretty way.

title: we can't be friends
description: Makes you appreciate sadness, slowly accepting it. Like you’re trying to be mature about it, but it still stings every time.

title: Nivel Dios
description: Emotional Spanish vocals that feel direct and unfiltered. They are finally saying the hard part out loud, after long moping.

title: Don't Smile
description: A calm kind of irkness, like you’re done being polite about it and cut the bullshit. The bite is subtle, but it’s definitely there.

title: Eyes Without A Face
description: Iconic 80s mood that feels romantic but a little eerie. Like looking staraight at someone you can’t read, and still wanting more.

title: Picture You
description: Big feelings being spoken softly in a movie scene in your head. Feels like wanting someone so bad you turn it into art.

title: LENTO
description: Slow and close, like she’s singing right next to you. Makes you feel vulnerable but wanting control over how a hearbreak unflods.

title: Diggin' On You
description: Smooth classic R&B that feels like waking up to sunlight through blinds. Flirty, effortless, and makes you move without thinking.

title: in your hands
description: Halle delivers dark fairy tale vocals that state someone's reality after they lose you. The relationship dynamic is interesting, as she acknowledges she is what makes her partner great.

title: El Sol No Regresa
description: Upbeat Spanish pop-rock with a dramatic shine that makes you feel like you’re running from heartbreak, but somewhat hopeful. Built for loud car singing.

title: White Roses
description: Sticky, floaty production that feels like being half-awake in a neon dream. The groove pulls you in while the lyrics keep you slightly unsettled.

title: Ring My Bell
description: Classic disco flirtiness with a timeless bounce. Instant mood lift that makes you move without asking permission.

title: Eyes on my baby
description: Cute and upbeat with a soft roundness, like being confident and crushy at the same time. Feels like city lights and texting too fast.

title: un día
description: Spanish-language melancholy that feels gentle but very direct. Like replaying a conversation you wish you could redo, slower this time.

title: Love Of My Life
description: Bittersweet and reminescent, like missing someone while pretending it’s fine. Feels like end of a chapter, nostalgic.

title: GO STUPID
description: Unhinged pop confidence that makes you feel fearless for three minutes. Like choosing chaos on purpose and loving it.

title: Girl, so confusing
description: Deals with messy feelings with a glossy punch, like overthinking in bathroom mirror. Sharp, direct, and weirdly freeing.

title: L'AMOUR DE MA VIE [OVER NOW EXTENDED EDIT]
description: Switches from cold emotion to full release, like flipping slow motion chaos. Feels like finally being over it and still wanting them to know.

title: Dive
description: Smooth and reassuring, like someone talking you down in a sweett way. Makes love feel safe and steady.

title: A Warning
description: Jangly and urgent, like realizing the red flags too late but still wanting to run toward it. Feels like a fast walk with loud thoughts.

title: Made for Me
description: Romantic r&b that feels like being chosen on purpose. Smooth vocals with that classic glow that makes you want to text someone you miss.

title: SWEET N SOUR
description: Sugar rush pop with a punch, like smiling while you’re plotting your comeback. Loud, fast, and kinda addictive.

title: Every Little Thing I Say I Do
description: Bright tune that feels like a clean slate and fresh air. Makes you want to walk faster and believe things will work out.

title: Maria
description: Confident pop-disco bounce that feels like strutting with determination. Recognized the impact of that a third person had on someone's live. Smooth hooks that make you feel unstoppable.

title: Watcha Doing
description: Playful, flirty energy that feels like a late-night text you actually send. Light, bouncy, and made for moving.

title: Bourgeoisieses
description: Sharp and dramatic, like turning bitterness into a performance you can dance to. Feels like calling out the world while still wanting to belong.

title: Never Ending Song
description: Sparkly pop nostalgia that feels like the first seconds of a crush. Catchy in a way that loops in your head like it’s on purpose.

title: This Kiss
description: Pure sunshine country-pop that feels like windows down and zero problems. Makes romance feel easy and a little cheesy but enjoyable.

title: II MOST WANTED
description: Road-trip friendship and loyalty with a bittersweet edge. Feels like riding into the sunset with someone who actually gets you.

title: Rave Angel
description: Glittery club-pop rush that feels like levitating in flashing lights. Big hooks, floaty production, and pure main-character momentum.

title: Limelight
description: Shiny pop confidence that feels like stepping into the spotlight on purpose. Clean, bouncy beat that makes you walk faster without noticing.

title: Change
description: Smooth modern R&B that feels honest without being dramatic. Like accepting something is shifting, even if you still wish it didn’t.

title: imperfect for you
description: Tender, close-up vocals that feel like a quiet confession. Soft love with a realistic tone, like choosing each other anyway.

title: Goddess
description: Velvet jazz-pop that feels like candlelight burning slow. Romantic in a composed way, like elegance you can actually breathe in.

title: eternal sunshine
description: Bittersweet pop that feels bright on the surface but heavy underneath. Like trying to move forward while your heart keeps rewinding.

title: Chocolatito
description: Flirty Spanish pop with a cheeky bounce and sweet swagger. Feels like dancing around the kitchen with a grin you can’t hide.

title: Heladito
description: Sweet and silky like melting candy. Kali’s voice floats over a groove that’s chill but still addictive, like a slow summer night.

title: Se Me Olvidó
description: Classic Latin ballad sadness that feels personal. Like remembering something you pretended you forgot, and it hits again.

title: Tu Misterioso Alguien
description: Catchy electro-pop drama with a wink. Feels like dancing through jealousy for someone you aren't sure exists.

title: Te Mentiría
description: Heartbreak with a steady pulse, like holding your voice together while you admit the truth. Emotional but controlled, built for late-night replay.

title: Tummy Hurts
description: Gut-punch honesty that feels too real, in the best way. Big vocals meet emotional messiness, like saying what you usually swallow.

title: Mil Horas
description: Classic Argentinian rock nostalgia that makes you sing before you realize you’re emotional. Feels like late nights, cigarettes, and memories you can’t quit.

title: Loco
description: Loose, swaggering rock that feels like chaos with charm. Like you’re a mess, you know it, and you’re still walking like you’re fine.

title: Un Vino, Una Cerveza
description: Peruvian classic that feels like talking through heartbreak over drinks. Casual and poetic at the same time, like memory turned into a singalong.

title: Cuéntame
description: Emotional rock-pop that feels like asking questions you already know the answer to. Built for loud singing when you need it out of your system.

title: Alive
description: Big voice, big surge of life. Feels like turning pain into power and letting it fill the whole room.

title: Glowing Up
description: Inspiring energy with heart behind it. Like choosing yourself, dressing well, and stepping outside like the world owes you space.

title: Intrusive Thoughts
description: Fast pop spiral that feels like your brain won’t shut up. Catchy in a way that makes the chaos feel weirdly fun.

title: Again
description: Smooth rock longing with that classic ache. Feels like admitting you’d do it all over again, even knowing how it ends.

title: In My Room
description: Close and tender, like a secret you don’t want to translate. Soft vocals and guitar warmth that feels like staying in with your feelings on purpose.

title: What's The Time Where You Are?
description: Long-distance longing that feels gentle but constant. Like checking the clock just to feel closer to someone you miss.

title: Fotografía
description: Memory-heavy duet that feels like flipping through old photos you promised you wouldn’t. Sweet and sad in the same breath, built for singing along.

title: Lamento Boliviano
description: Classic Latin rock sadness that somehow feels good to shout. Like turning heartbreak into a chant and letting it carry you.

title: From The Start
description: Flirty jazz-pop sweetness that feels like a crush you can’t hide. Light and charming, like smiling at someone and hoping they notice.

title: Bewitched
description: Romantic ache that feels soft but deep, like being under a spell you don’t want to break. Elegant melodies that linger after the song ends.

title: How Can I Make It Ok?
description: Soft-to-loud emotional crash that feels like trying to fix something that’s already breaking. Dreamy guitars with a heavy weight underneath.

title: Frágil
description: Tender Mexican heartbreak that feels simple and direct. Like admitting you’re not okay and brittle, but saying it softly so it doesn’t scare anyone.

title: Your Love
description: Iconic 80s hook that hits instantly. Bright, driving energy that feels like cruising with the windows down and pretending you’re in a movie.

title: Alone
description: Power ballad drama that explodes with Ann's powerhouse voice. Big chorus and bigger feelings, like loneliness turning into something you can finally scream out.

title: high road
description: Power-pop resilience that feels like choosing yourself out loud. Big chorus energy that turns frustration into forward motion.

title: End Of Time
description: Urgent pop rush that feels endless and electric. Like loving someone so loudly it stretches past the moment.

title: Love Me Right
description: Smooth, self-assured groove that feels grounded and cheeky. Calm confidence that doesn’t need to raise its voice.

title: un x100to
description: Soft heartbreak that sneaks up on you. Like missing someone quietly but deeply, replaying every almost-message.

title: Dreamland
description: Floating memories wrapped in soft distortion. Feels like looking back at youth through a warped but gentle lens.

title: En El Coche
description: Light, breezy Spanish pop built for night drives. Feels like conversations that only happen when the city is quiet.

title: Sunkissing
description: Gentle pop glow that feels like golden-hour skin. Easy, romantic, and effortlessly sweet.

title: Jane Says
description: Unsettling calm with a constant edge underneath. Feels like watching someone spiral while pretending everything’s fine.

title: Liz
description: Off-the-wall pop funk that feels unhinged in the best way. Like letting your weirdness run the show.

title: See The Light
description: Old-soul optimism wrapped in a modern sheen. Feels like believing in love again, slowly and timeless.

title: Hey Girl
description: Gentle romance with a vintage sway. Like a smile held a second too long.

title: I Can See It In Your Eyes
description: 80s charm with a knowing playfulness. Feels like realizing the truth before it’s ever said out loud.

title: last time
description: Quiet sadness that feels personal and fragile. Like reliving a goodbye you weren’t ready for.

title: Stairway to Heaven (Live At The Kennedy Center)
description: Goosebump-inducing performance that feels sacred and holy. Power, respect, and emotional release all at once. Even better than the original

title: UN DÍA (ONE DAY)
description: Soft global pop longing that feels hopeful and sad at the same time. Like believing timing might still work out.

title: October Passed Me By
description: Quiet grief that lingers without asking permission. Feels like missing someone long after you thought you’d healed.

title: Mary Jane (All Night Long)
description: Smooth, late-night R&B comfort. Feels like leaning into yourself when the world finally slows down.

title: What It Is
description: Easy confidence and smooth groove. Feels like clarity after overthinking.

title: Yonaguni
description: Soft heartbreak wrapped in melody and distance. Like missing someone so much it becomes its own place.

title: Mind Over Matter (Reprise)
description: Swelling release that feels earned. Like surviving something and realizing you’re still standing, while being hyper aware of your own humanity.

title: Hold the Line
description: Classic urgency with a timeless hook. Feels like pushing forward even when it’s uncomfortable.

title: California
description: Bittersweet reflection on youth and illusion. Like realizing the dream didn’t save you, but it taught you something.

title: Flaws
description: Tender honesty that feels human and exposed. Like admitting love is messy but worth it.

title: Oblivion
description: Extremely heavy emotions in polished production. Dan's voice conveys the deepest feelings of life being finite. Feels like standing still while the world moves on.

title: Daniel In The Den
description: High-stakes momentum with a dramatic edge. Feels like choosing courage when fear is louder.
